page.title: Learn About CBT
page.subtitle: Understanding Cognitive Behavioral Therapy and how it can help with social anxiety

intro.title: What is Cognitive Behavioral Therapy?
intro.content: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT) is a well-researched, evidence-based approach that helps people identify and change unhelpful thought patterns and behaviors. For those with AvPD and social anxiety, CBT can be particularly effective in challenging the negative assumptions we make about ourselves and others.

howItWorks.title: How CBT Works
howItWorks.description: CBT is based on the idea that our thoughts, feelings, and behaviors are interconnected:
howItWorks.breakingCycle: By changing our thoughts, we can influence our feelings and behaviors, breaking this negative cycle.

cognitive.title: Cognitive Restructuring
cognitive.description: Identifying and challenging negative thought patterns to develop more balanced perspectives.

evidence.title: Evidence Examination
evidence.description: Looking at the facts for and against our anxious thoughts to see if they're really true.

behavioral.title: Behavioral Experiments
behavioral.description: Testing our fears in safe, gradual ways to see if our predictions come true.

mindfulness.title: Mindfulness Integration
mindfulness.description: Observing thoughts without judgment, reducing their power over us.

distortions.title: Common Thought Distortions in Social Anxiety
distortions.description: Recognizing these patterns is the first step to changing them:

mindReading.title: Mind Reading
mindReading.description: Assuming we know what others are thinking about us (usually negative).

catastrophizing.title: Catastrophizing
catastrophizing.description: Expecting the worst possible outcome in social situations.

allOrNothing.title: All-or-Nothing Thinking
allOrNothing.description: Seeing social interactions as complete successes or total failures.

personalization.title: Personalization
personalization.description: Taking responsibility for others' moods or reactions.

filtering.title: Mental Filtering
filtering.description: Focusing only on negative aspects while ignoring positives.

benefits.title: Benefits of CBT for AvPD
list: Helps build more realistic thinking patterns
Provides practical tools for daily challenges
Can be practiced independently with guidance

gettingStarted.title: Getting Started with re-frame
gettingStarted.content: Our tool makes it easy to practice CBT techniques on your own. Simply share a thought that's troubling you, and we'll guide you through the process of examining and reframing it. Remember, change takes time and practice - be patient and kind with yourself.

resources.note: While re-frame is a helpful tool, it's not a replacement for professional therapy. If you're struggling, please consider reaching out to a mental health professional.
